column4: hello, does nvidia GT555M (lenovo Y570) have drivers for Ubuntu or yet ?
I would believe so. I can check for ya
http://www.nvidia.com/object/linux-display-ia32-270.41.06-driver.html
that's the one you need or a newer version. But that there supports the 555m
so 270.41.06 will do the trick
thanks a lot but do u think it might work if ubuntu is installed as guest in virtual box, or it depende on virtual box  ?
you need the nvidia driver installed on the host
then you need to install the "guest additions" on the virtual machine. That will give you 3d acceleration. I have the same setup but different nvidia card

basically virtual machines have their own drivers which they call "Guest additions" that allow the VM to use your real hardware more efficiently. So if your using ubuntu in a VM you don't need the nvidia driver.
exactly i had it installed, but unity 3D was so sluggish, so i had to switch to unity 2D
ohh
okay have you tried increasing vram of the guest and making sure 3d acceleration is on?
yeah guest addition updates and virtual box updates do help 3d acceleration.
yeah thats all virtual box supports, same with vmware
:-) ok i though vmware was more powerfull in that domain
but vmware player has superior 3d performance. Where I can get modern games to run without lag.
your correct
I keep vmware player (free version) just for when I need good 3d acceleration. but I use virtual box for most of my development.
I don't understand why that is but 128MB can do quite a bit. I'd give it a shot. Vmware player is 100% free unlike other versions, so it might be worth using until virtualbox catches up some.
you are correct.
I've had issues with 3d acceleration on virtualbox then loaded it on vmware and it works fine. so thats my advise to work around that for now.
